transparency_law.name: Government Records Access and Management Act (GRAMA)

response_requirements.initial_response_description: Records officers must respond within 10 business days of receipt; should respond as soon as reasonably possible
response_requirements.final_response_notes: For expedited requests: 5 business days maximum when information benefits public
response_requirements.extension_notes: May extend if request requires search of large number of records, search of unorganized records, would unreasonably interfere with operations, or requires legal review
response_requirements.good_faith_standard: Should respond as soon as reasonably possible

fee_structure.search_fee: May charge for searches exceeding 15 minutes
fee_structure.search_fee_notes: Searches taking 15 minutes or less: Free. Additional searches: Hourly rate. May charge staff time for compiling, searching, retrieving, producing.
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: First 10 single-sided copies: Free. Photocopying: Reasonable actual cost.
fee_structure.fee_waiver_notes: Must provide fee estimate if costs exceed $50
fee_structure.reasonableness_standard: May charge actual cost of providing records

exemptions.description: May not be disclosed except to record subject - includes personal information in certain circumstances
May not be disclosed except as provided by statute - includes sensitive government information
May be disclosed at discretion of custodian - includes investigative records, drafts, etc.
Investigative records protected during active investigation; certain records remain protected permanently
Employee records generally private; some information may be public (name, title, salary range)
Health information generally private; limited exceptions for public health purposes

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Must appeal within 30 days of initial denial. CAO has 10 business days to respond (5 for expedited, 12 if confidentiality involved)
appeal_process.second_level_deadline_notes: May appeal CAO denial to State Records Committee; Committee schedules hearing within 5 days and issues binding order
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: District court may award attorney fees to prevailing party; damages for willful and knowing violations
appeal_process.criminal_penalties_notes: Willful and knowing violation is misdemeanor

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Written request must include requester's name, mailing address, and telephone number
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Written request with name, address, phone, and specific description of records
requester_requirements.specific_format: May submit via Open Records Portal, email, fax, mail, or hand delivery
requester_requirements.constitutional_right: Utah Constitution Article I, Section 27 provides constitutional right of access

agency_obligations.business_hours_notes: Public records available for inspection during regular business hours; reasonable facilities provided
agency_obligations.electronic_submission_notes: Statewide online Open Records Portal available at archives.utah.gov/opengovernment/
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Electronic access should be provided when feasible
agency_obligations.redaction_requirements: Must redact exempt portions only; burden of proof on governmental entity for non-disclosure
agency_obligations.liberal_interpretation: All records are public unless otherwise expressly provided by statute

oversight_body.name: Government Records Ombudsman
oversight_body.role: Mediates disputes between requesters and agencies; provides guidance on GRAMA compliance
oversight_body.contact_info: Utah Division of Archives and Records Service

official_resources.request_portal_notes: Centralized statewide online portal for submitting requests

primary_sources: Utah Code Title 63G, Chapter 2 - Government Records Access and Management Act (GRAMA)
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official Utah statutes. Response time: 10 business days (5 for expedited when benefits public). Three-tier appeal: CAO → State Records Committee → District Court. Constitutional right established in Article I, Section 27. First 10 copies free, searches under 15 min free. Must provide fee estimate if exceeds $50. Government Records Ombudsman provides mediation. Statewide Open Records Portal available.
unique_characteristics: First 10 copies free, searches under 15 min free
